node.title: 'The virus is here earlier than we'd hoped': Seven new COVID cases in Queensland, four in the community
node.alt: Queensland Health Minister Yvette D'Ath speaks at a media conference.
node.description: Queensland recordsÂ seven new cases of COVID-19, four of which have been active in the community.
node.content:
["Queensland has recorded seven new cases of COVID-19 overnight \u2014 two acquired overseas in hotel quarantine, two from interstate and three acquired locally.", "Health Minister Yvette D'Ath said four of the cases had been infectious in the community including a Gold Coast couple who were infectious for up to 13 days in the community.", "One case is linked to the school reunion in South Australia which has become a super-spreader event.", "\"One of our overseas arrivals had travelled from South Africa and we had been doing genomic sequencing on this person,\" Ms D'Ath said.", "\"The public health unit have ruled out that it is Delta, but we haven't been able to confirm if it is Omicron. But it is being treated as if it is.\"", "Ms D'Ath said the state had 30 active cases of COVID-19.", "She said 10,194 tests had been conducted in the past 24 hours and 10,573 vaccines had\u00a0been administered.", "First vaccination doses have been administered to 87.03 per cent of Queenslanders, while 77.7 per cent have received both doses.", "
Adelaide declared a hot spot
", "", "
Heavily mutated Omicron variant puts scientist on alert
", "Greater Adelaide has been declared a hotspot, with arrival restrictions to come in place from tomorrow morning.", "\"Anyone who has been in Greater Adelaide since 1am on the 28th of November who arrives in Queensland after 1am tomorrow\u00a0will be required to go into 14 days mandatory home or hotel quarantine,\" Ms D'Ath said.", "\"They are required to be fully vaccinated. But if they arrive after 1am tomorrow \u2026\u00a0we don't require them to have a negative PCR test.", "\"What we do require is them to get a test as soon as they possibly can.", "\"Anyone arriving after 1am Monday the 6th of December, you will need to receive a negative COVID PCR test result in 72 hours prior to arrival, as well as being fully vaccinated.\"", "Ms\u00a0D'Ath said because South Australia has opened its borders to hotspots around the country, Queensland was seeing cases present.", "\"We said when our borders open, that we will see the virus coming into our community,\" she said.", "\"People are going into those communities in South Australia with the virus and consequently infecting other people who have every right to travel to South Australia and to come back here and are eligible to do so, but it has meant that the virus has come here earlier than we hoped.\"", "
No change to roadmap
", "Ms D'ath said there would\u00a0be no change to the re-opening road map for the state.", "\"There's thousands of [people] coming in a matter of days. The vaccination rate isn't as high as it should be and we've got cases on the Gold Coast. Please come out and get vaccinated,\" she\u00a0said.", "The Health Minister said Greater Adelaide hadn't been declared a hot spot earlier as there was just the one cluster arising from the school reunion.", "\"Now there is a very long list, as I understand, schools, hospitals, churches, right through Greater Adelaide,\" she said.", "
'We're just at the start of opening up'
", "\"We will absolutely get to a point in Australia that COVID is just another infectious disease that we're managing, that everyone's going off and getting their boosters like we get our flu shots and we are managing it in our community,\" Ms D'Ath \u00a0said.", "\"We're just at the start of opening up, we will have cases we will have many cases every day.", "\"I would love that I can stand up and go 'well, yeah we've got 100 cases today but none of them are needing hospitalisation'. That is my wish that we can simply put out no hospitalisation, no ICU, but that comes down to a vaccination rates .\"", "Acting Chief Health Officer\u00a0Peter Aitken\u00a0said a positive case that had been in South Africa showed characteristics of Omicron.", "\"There's a number of theories that may be an intermediary step towards the evolution and development of Omicron. But we don't know enough about it,\" Dr Aitken said.", "\"There are genetic changes that mean it may or may not behave like Omicron, it may behave differently. The most important thing is that they're not in the community.\"", "\"Our people from forensic and scientific services are looking at [the case]\u00a0extensively and spent the night talking to counterparts nationally and internationally.\""]
